name: openbmb/UltraFeedback
description: UltraFeedback is a significant dataset created by openbmb, containing about 64,000 prompts sourced from various resources. These prompts are used to query multiple large language models (LLMs), generating 4 different responses for each prompt, resulting in a total of 256k samples. This dataset is a valuable resource for researchers and developers working on training powerful reward models and critic models, as it offers a diverse and extensive dataset for improving the performance of AI in natural language processing.
citeAs: @misc{cui2023ultrafeedback,       title={UltraFeedback: Boosting Language Models with High-quality Feedback},        author={Ganqu Cui and Lifan Yuan and Ning Ding and Guanming Yao and Wei Zhu and Yuan Ni and Guotong Xie and Zhiyuan Liu and Maosong Sun},       year={2023},       eprint={2310.01377},       archivePrefix={arXiv},       primaryClass={cs.CL} }
creator: openbmb
keywords: Preference Data, Large-scale, Fine-grained, Reward Models, Critic Models Training
